Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Hemodynamic and Anatomic Changes in Great Saphenous Vein Tributaries After Endovenous Laser Ablation

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants underwent EVLA from April 2022 to June 2023.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at the Hospital das Clínicas de Pernambuco/UFPE, this trial included symptomatic adult patients with chronic venous disease classified as C2 to C5.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved EVLA with a 1470-nm diode laser, while the control was standard care.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the hemodynamic and anatomic changes in great saphenous vein (GSV) tributaries following endovenous laser ablation (EVLA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in GSV tributary diameter and reflux, assessed by Doppler ultrasound preoperatively and 3 months post-treatment.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants underwent EVLA from April 2022 to June 2023.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 25 patients, 23 completed the study, with 28 lower limbs analyzed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The average GSV diameter decreased significantly in all regions (P ≤ .001). Among 101 tributaries, a significant reduction in diameter and reflux was observed (P < .001). The Venous Clinical Severity Score decreased from 9 to 5 points (P < .001).
